DOC.brief_summary: To determine propranolol , amitriptyline , topiramate decrease headache frequency patient chronic post-traumatic headache .
DOC.detailed_description: A total 240 patient meet International Classification Headache Disorders ( ICHD ) diagnostic criterion chronic post-traumatic headache enrol . Subjects recruit Neurology Clinic Madigan Army Medical Center . Study participant U.S. Army soldier sustain mild traumatic head injury deploy combat theater result chronic post-traumatic headache . Subjects randomize placebo , propranolol ( target dose 80 mg day ) , amitriptyline ( target dose 50 mg day ) , topiramate ( target dose 100 mg day ) 3 month . The primary outcome measure mean number headache day per month third month treatment . Secondary outcome measure include proportion subject least 25 % reduction headache frequency , headache severity ( 0-10 scale ) , headache duration ( hour ) , headache-related disability ( measure Headache Impact Test Migraine Disability Assessment Scale ) , PTSD symptom checklist score , medication side effect tolerability .

Headaches begin within 1 week mild traumatic head injury . 2 . Headaches persist > 3 month head trauma . 3 . Patient another headache disorder attributable head trauma account least half patient 's headache episode . 2 . Patient currently take propranolol , amitriptyline , topiramate reason . 3 . Patient previously try propranolol , amitriptyline , topiramate headache treatment . 4 . Patient start new treatment headache prevention within last 6 week . Prophylactic treatment initiate prior 6 week ago allow long dose regimen stable . Medications abort acute headache also allow . 5 . Patient previously try two medication headache prevention . 6 . Patient use narcotic analgesic average 10 day month . 7 . Patient medical condition take medication consider contraindication propranolol , topiramate , amitriptyline .
